description: In colloquial usage in English since 1612, from Bengali নবাব (nôbab), from Persian نواب‎ (navâb), from Arabic نُوَّاب‎ (nuwwāb), the honorific plural of نَائِب‎ (nāʔib, “deputy”).

entries.meaning: (historical) An Indian ruler within the Mogul empire.
(by extension) Someone of great wealth or importance.
examples: Synonyms: tycoon, magnate; see also Thesaurus:ruler

entries.meaning: (by extension) A person with a grandiose style or manner.
